name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a cable machine with the handle at chest height. Hold one end of the cable handle in each hand, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing each other.
2. Keep your core engaged, squeeze your glutes, and lift your chest up slightly to maintain good posture.
3. Slowly press the handle away from you by extending your arms, keeping them straight and your elbows slightly bent. Focus on using the rear deltoids to perform this movement.
4. Continue pressing the handle until it is at a 45-degree angle to your body or as far as comfortable.
5. Hold the position for a brief moment to contract the muscles and engage the mind-muscle connection.
6. Gradually lower yourself back to the starting position, keeping control throughout the entire range of motion.
7. Perform for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Cable Rear Delt Fly is an isolation exercise that engages the rear deltoids to improve shoulder strength and stability.
